posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Yes, I have done such a build for another player Stag, it was the one with the picture of Solare of Astora but don't remember the thread's name...Anyway his server has a lot of modifications, I noticed the same thing for the divine feats & some good things for the barbarians along with some nerfings for the dev. critical builds but there were also many spell changes as well, it definitely needs time to let all those sink-in. What i recommend in those cases is to play a weapon master if you want something with big damage that never gets nerfed. Of course, wm's tend to have very bad saves with very few exceptions so one has to decide what he wants from his character before I actually recommend such a build.

Edit: Or you can play a dwarven (ftr/rog/cot) till you learn the ropes and having nothing to worry about...

Edit 2: A melee cleric is another strong possibility of course. I think that also gets the vote of Empyre as well.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Speaking personally - and against conventional wisdom - I'm still not great with Weapon Masters. I know, I know, I'm a knuckle-runner who doesn't do anything much outside melee, so that should be my go-to type of build, but it just isn't. However, I do try to pay attention to you clever buggers, so I wonder, then...what about a Barb/WM/CoT? CoT should mitigate against the otherwise crappy saves, regardless of CHA, and also brings bonus feats by the truckload. Admittedly you won't have anything with plate armour, but, hey, "come and have a go if you think you're hard enough", seems a relatively reasonable attitude to take. You probably wouldn't need many levels of WM, so what about a Barb 15, WM 7, CoT 18? Does that make any sense?

EDIT: Ninja'd  by Velerfor - which probably says something in itself...
